definition: A measure of space or separation between two entities, often referring to the physical or emotional distance maintained between individuals or objects. It is commonly used to describe the level of detachment or reserve in interpersonal relationships, as well as the physical gap between objects or locations.

examples.german: Die Distanz zwischen den beiden Städten beträgt 200 Kilometer.
examples.english: The distance between the two cities is 200 kilometers.

examples.german: Er hielt aus Respekt einen gewissen Abstand.
examples.english: Out of respect, he kept a certain distance.

examples.german: Die soziale Distanz zwischen den Klassen ist immer noch spürbar.
examples.english: The social distance between the classes is still noticeable.

examples.german: Sie bewahrte stets eine gewisse Distanz zu ihren Kollegen.
examples.english: She always maintained a certain distance from her colleagues.

examples.german: Die Distanz zwischen den beiden Ländern führte zu politischen Spannungen.
examples.english: The distance between the two countries led to political tensions.
